post.summary: Send the provided e-mails
post.description:
NsApiSlow threshold: 5000 ms.
<para />## Online Restricted: ## The EMail agent is not available in Online by default. Access must be requested specifically when app is registered.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Emails

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Optional comma separated list of properties to include in the result. Other fields are then nulled out to reduce payload size: "Name,department,category". Default = show all fields.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

post.summary: Start syncing of the given accounts, from mail server to SuperOffice database cache.
post.description:
Only one of these API calls may run at a time. If one is already active, we return after 1 (one) second, with no indication that the sync was not really started. This is a way to throttle sync'ing to avoid making the mail servers angry at us. <br/> There is an <b>additional</b> level of throttling within the implementation as well, limiting us to a maximum of 10 tasks, regardless of how many associates are to to be sync'ed. The outer, API-level lock is released when all those tasks are done.
NsApiSlow threshold: 5000 ms.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.EMailEntity.description:
All information about an e-mail
<para />
Carrier object for EMailEntity.
Services for the EMailEntity Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IEMailAgent">EMail Agent</see>.

From.description: Who did the e-mail originate from

Flags.description: Flag status of this mail (unread, replied, deleted )

IsSent.description: Is this a sent e-mail (not new)

EMailSOInfo.description: Glue between SuperOffice data and an e-mail.

ServerId.description: Unique id for the e-mail on the server

FolderName.description: Name of folder the e-mail belongs in

InReplyTo.description: The envelope of the email this email is a reply to, if it exists

RepliedAt.description: When this email was replied at

HasCalendarData.description: If this email contains exactly one iCal appointment

CalMethod.description: Method stored in the associated iCal appointment. Indicates if the iCal data is a reply, counter proposal etc.

CalReplyStatus.description: Reply status stored in calendar data for the ical method is REPLY

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.EMailAddress.description:
Carrier object for EMailAddress.
Services for the EMailAddress Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IEMailAgent">EMail Agent</see>.

DuplicatePersonIds.description: All persons with this EmailAddress stored in db is listed here

Name.description: The name on the email address

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.TableRight.description:
Wraps a table right together with an explanatory reason.
Code can indicate why access is restricted.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldProperty.description: Class holding properties like field length, field type about a field in the carrier.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldRight.description:
Wraps the field right together with an explanatory reason.
Also adds logical operators to the field rights so that they can be easily combined.

GetMailFromInReplyTo: Get email from db based on In-Reply-To Message Id
SendAndSaveEmailToTmpDocument: Send the provided e-mail and create tmp document ready to archive
SaveEmailToTmpDocument: Save the Email as a tmp document ready to archive

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.DocumentEntity.description: Partial DocumentEntity class associating the generated DocumentEntity with an interface.

UpdatedBy.description: The person that last updated the appointment.

CreatedBy.description: The person that first created the document. The property is read-only.

OurRef.description: Our reference, searchable field from freetext search

Description.description: The actual text, max 2047 significant characters even though it is stored as a larger data type on some databases

DocumentTemplate.description:
The template type of the document. 
<para>Use MDO List name "doctmpl" to get list items.</para>

Person.description:
A document may also be connected to a person; this must be a contact person registered on the current company. This does not mean however that a person is required. 
<para>Use MDO List name "person" to get list items.</para>

Associate.description:
The owner of the document - the associate whose checklist the document is in. 
<para>Use MDO List name "associate" to get list items.</para>

Contact.description:
The contact associated with the document. It may also be null if no contact is associated with the document. 
<para>Use MDO List name "contact" to get list items.</para>

Project.description:
A document may also be connected to a project, so you see the document both on the company card, and on the project card. This does not mean however that a project is required. 
<para>Use MDO List name "project" to get list items.</para>

ExternalRef.description: External reference for document plugin to resolve document identity (Notes ID, e-mail message ID, whatever)

Completed.description: Document Completed state. This is the part of the Status property.

ActiveLinks.description: Number of active links to sale, document, appointment.

Type.description: Is this a normal document or a mail-merge or report?

Links.description: List of all elements linked to the document.

Sale.description:
A document may also be connected to a sale, so you see the document on the company card, on the project card and on the sale card. This does not mean however that a sale is required. May be null. 
<para>Use MDO List name "sale" to get list items.</para>

SuggestedDocumentId.description: Suggested guide item that this document is an instance of (Note: NOT valid for appointments, they have their own link)

Snum.description: The sequence number allocated from refcount on used template when creating the document

UserDefinedFields.description:
Deprecated: Use {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.DocumentEntity.CustomFields} instead.
Dictionary of user defined field data.
The key string is the ProgId of the UdefField, or if the ProgId is empty it is a string of the format "SuperOffice:[UdefFieldIdentity]", e.g. "SuperOffice:1234"

ExtraFields.description:
Deprecated: Use {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.DocumentEntity.CustomFields} instead.
Extra fields added to the carrier. This could be data from Plug-ins, the foreign key system, external applications, etc.

CustomFields.description:
Udef + Extra fields added to the carrier. Extra fields as defined by changes to database schema + user-defined fields as defined by admin.

Street and/or Postal address, in both formatted and structured forms. You only need to modify one of the two for the change to be registered.
<para />

Wgs84Longitude.description: Longitude (that's East/west), decimal degrees, relative to WGS 84 ellipsoid. SuperOffice ASA is at 10.73159. This value needs no further grid reference or other qualifying information.

LocalizedAddress.description: LocalizedFieldArray is a list of LocalizedFieldList objects. Used to store localized information such as formatted address data.

Street.description: Street address (company street, person address, delivery address). LocalizedAddress changes override this property, so you do not have to change both Localized and this.

Postal.description: Postal address (company postal, billing address). LocalizedAddress changes override this property, so you do not have to change both Localized and this.

Formatted.description:
Read-only formatted address multi-line string. Combines street and postal into one string. e.g.: <c>"Postboks 123,
Brugata 123,
1234 OSLO
"</c> or <c>"Postbox 123,
Bridgelane 123,
West Tooting,
East Shire ES2 W31
"</c>.

<para />

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.EMailCarr.description: SyncEmailAccount: Sync the given account, from mail server to SuperOffice database cache. This API has no throttling, so please be careful with multiple concurrent calls. Mail servers may become angry.

SyncEmailAccounts: Start syncing of the given accounts, from mail server to SuperOffice database cache. Only one of these API calls may run at a time. If one is already active, we return after 1 (one) second, with no indication that the sync was not really started. This is a way to throttle sync'ing to avoid making the mail servers angry at us. <br/> There is an <b>additional</b> level of throttling within the implementation as well, limiting us to a maximum of 10 tasks, regardless of how many associates are to to be sync'ed. The outer, API-level lock is released when all those tasks are done.

SuperOffice.WebApi.v1.Carriers.EMailCarr.description: GetEMailFromId: Get en e-mail based on its unique id
SendEMails: Send the provided e-mails
SaveEMail: Save the passed e-mail back to the server
AuthenticateIncoming: Authenticate against a mail-server to retrieve e-mails from
AuthenticateOutgoing: Authenticate against a mail server to send items with

GetFolderList: Retrieve all folders for the mail account. String is separated in sections by the paragraph character.  First section contains the folder delimeter char. Next is folder name. Additional sections may be unread and total items.
GetAttachment: Retrieve an attachment from an e-mail
MarkAsRead: Mark one or more e-mails as (un)read
GetFolderEMailCount: Retrieve total/unread mail items in current folder
Delete: Delete specified mail items
MoveToFolder: Moved specified items from current folder to targetFolder
EmptyFolder: Delete all items in folder specified in the connection object
GetEMailAsStream: Retrieve an e-mail optionally stripping attachments as a stream
FindAddress: Search for contacts and persons with the specified e-mail address (exact match on the email address string required)
GetEMailFromDocumentId: Get an e-mail based on an archived document
GetUnsanitizedEMailFromDocumentId: Get an e-mail based on an archived document. The returned value is not sanitized.
GetEMailFromAttachmentId: Get an e-mail based on an email and attachment id
GetUnsanitizedEMailFromAttachmentId: Get an e-mail based on an email and attachment id. The returned value is not sanitized.
GetEMailFromDocumentAttachmentId: Get an e-mail based on an email in the archive system and attachment id
GetUnsanitizedEMailFromDocumentAttachmentId: Get an e-mail based on an email in the archive system and attachment id. The returned value is not sanitized.
GetEMailEnvelopes: Retrieve a set of e-mail envelopes
SetSubscription: Set subscription on or off on a set of folders
CreateFolder: Create a new folder on the server
DeleteFolder: Delete a folder from the server
CreateEMailFromDocumentEntity: Get an e-mail based on the provided DocumentEntity
CreateEMailFromMimeMessage: Get an e-mail based on the provided MIME-message
GetFolderInfo: Retrieve information about folders.  If folders parameter is not specified(null), information about all subscribed folders will be returned.
GetFolderHasNewEMail: Check if folder has received new items since previous access.
GetEMailAddresses: Get information about one or more email addresses, identified by IDs

RefreshFolder: Refresh the given folders - i.e., fetch data from the mail server and update the in-database cache. This may happen synchronously or as a batch task, the return value will be 0 if the processing was synchronous, or the batch task id if a batch task is used.
GetEMailFromTemp:
Authenticate:
GetEmailMessageIds:

GetExtendedEmailMessageIds: Gets not only the Message-Id's but also the UID's and the uniquevalidity property in this format-> uvalidity:uid:MsgId - and this format should be understood by GetEmailsAsString() and DeleteExtended().
GetEmailsAsString:
DeleteExtended:
RelayMessage:
GetEMail: Get en e-mail based on its primary key in the DB
GetUnsanitizedEMail: Get en e-mail based on its primary key in the DB. The returned value is not sanitized.
MarkEmailsAsRead: Mark one or more e-mails as (un)read
DeleteEmails: Delete specified mail items and optionally move to the specified folder
MoveEmailsToTrash: Delete specified mail items and move to the Trash folder
Save: Save the e-mail back to the database
SaveToMailServer: Save the passed e-mail back to the mail server

SuperOffice Password.description:
SuperOffice username:password are passed in Base64-encoded. 

You can also pass inn an unencoded ticket 7T:abc== with the HTTP Authenticate header.

SuperId Authentication.description:
SuperOffice SuperId OAuth implicit flow. 
You need to issue a request to the SuperId authorization URL
    https://online.superoffice.com/login/common/oauth/authorize?response_type=token
      &client_id=670734e0-4c5a-11e3-be9e-a171392e81db
      &redirect_uri=https://example.com/spa/

passing in the application id and redirect URL.

SuperId will log the user in, and redirect to the requested redirect URL with a #payload
containing the access token and claims. (The redirect URL must be registered with SuperId in advance)

   https://example.com/spa#access_token=8A%3aCust12227.AXRrCITpPBvQX3UbIohb
      &token_type=bearer
      &state=
      &expires_in=3600
      &ctx=Cust12227
      &netserver_url=https%3a%2f%2fsod.superoffice.com%2fCust12227%2fRemote%2fServices82%2f

You can take the #access_token value and pass it as the Authenticate HTTP header as a BEARER token.
